Class QueryService

public class QueryService
extends Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueryService

        @Autowired
public QueryService(List<com.yahoo.bullet.pubsub.Publisher> publishers,
                               List<com.yahoo.bullet.pubsub.Subscriber> subscribers,
                               @Value(value="${bullet.pubsub.sleep-ms}")
                               int sleep)
        Creates an instance using a List of Publishers and Subscribers.
        Parameters:
        publishers - The List of Publisher instances for writing queries.
        subscribers - The List of Subscriber instances for reading results.
        sleep - The duration to sleep for if a receive from PubSub is empty.

    • Method Detail

      • submit

        public void submit(String queryID,
                   String query,
                   QueryHandler queryHandler)
        Submit a query to Bullet and register it as a pending request.
        Parameters:
        queryID - The query ID to register request with.
        query - The query to register.
        queryHandler - The QueryHandler object that handles the query.

      • sendSignal

        public void sendSignal(String queryID,
                       com.yahoo.bullet.pubsub.Metadata.Signal signal)
        Submits a Metadata.Signal signal to Bullet for the given query ID. This query need not exist.
        Parameters:
        queryID - The query ID to submit the signal for.
        signal - The signal to send.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(com.yahoo.bullet.pubsub.PubSubMessage message)
        Sends a PubSubMessage to Bullet.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to send.

      • hasQuery

        public boolean hasQuery(String queryID)
        Checks to see if a given query exists.
        Parameters:
        queryID - The ID of the query.
        Returns:
        A boolean denoting if the query exists in this service.

      • getQuery

        public QueryHandler getQuery(String queryID)
        Retrieves the QueryHandler for the given ID, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        queryID - The ID of the query.
        Returns:
        The QueryHandler instance or null if the query does not exist.

      • removeQuery

        public QueryHandler removeQuery(String queryID)
        Removes a QueryHandler for the given ID.
        Parameters:
        queryID - The ID of the query.
        Returns:
        The QueryHandler instance or null if the query does not exist.

      • killQuery

        public QueryHandler killQuery(String queryID)
        Submits a Metadata.Signal#KILL signal to Bullet for the given query ID and removes the query. This does not invoke the QueryHandler.fail() method on the query.
        Parameters:
        queryID - The query ID to submit the kill signal for.
        Returns:
        The killed query, if it exists.

      • failQuery

        public boolean failQuery(String queryID)
        Fail a given query, if it exists. This does not submit anything to Bullet. It simply removes the query and invokes its QueryHandler.fail() method.
        Parameters:
        queryID - The ID of a query to fail, if it exists.
        Returns:
        true if the query was failed.

      • failAllQueries

        public void failAllQueries()
        Clears all pending queries. This does not send anything to Bullet.

      • queryCount

        public int queryCount()
        Get the number of running queries.
        Returns:
        The number of running queries.

      • close

        @PreDestroy
public void close()
        Stop all service threads and clear pending requests.

      • getNewQueryID

        public static String getNewQueryID()
        Get a new unique query ID.
        Returns:
        A new unique query ID.
